review_title: It’s hard, understaffed and strenuous with low end pay
job_title: Medical Imaging Assistant in Bellevue, WA
pros: Amazing, supportive coworkers, friendly people, nice looking campus, free coffee, good amount of PTO, great healthcare and benefits
cons: Management is mostly out of touch, always understaffed, high turnover rate, no room for growth within the company unless you get a specialized degree, extreme physical labor round the clock, no option for remote work within the company, only 8 hour shift and 5 day weeks for weekday employees, staff on the low end of the totem pole (especially the evening workers) are undervalued and our complaints mostly ignored, underpaid, have to pick up slack when understaffed which is almost always, but even when fully staffed, patient volume is so high these days that it feels understaffed, very few bonuses for non-RNs, got one bonus within 3 years and it was a retention bonus because everyone was quitting already, they do not pay you anything additional to train new staff and you always have to train new staff because everyone quits within months.

pros: The majority of the providers (physicians, ANRPs, social workers, nurses, psychiatric clinicians, and support staff) are fantastic and are why I gave 2 stars vs. one. cons: The greed, obvious prejudice regarding who receives care (white, wealthy folks are favored), and systemic sexism and racism within the employment structure and patient care delivery. There have been a couple of gems in the upper management sector (2 forced into retirement within the past 5 years), but mostly it's a good boys club, and the women at top are complicit at best.

review_title: Advise Emergency Dept Social Workers to Avoid
job_title: Emergency Department Social Worker in Bellevue, WA
pros: Skillful and friendly emergency department staff, health insurance benefits (of note, there are no full-time EDSW FTE, though, most are at least a 0.6 and subsequently eligible for health insurance), interesting and rewarding EDSW role (mostly psych assessments/treatment recommendations; occasionally interventions for domestic violence/sexual assault, child abuse, older adults, death, fetal demise), two week rotations with multiple days off in a row (most EDSW FTEs had five days off in a row every other week, though, the schedules are reportedly changing after five staff left within short succession of each other), friendly and collaborative providers.
cons: Inequitable pay (new grads earning higher than staff with multiple years post-grad experience - manager confirmed but no solutions offered), baseline poor staffing/retention (23 EDSW left in four years - notably, there are only nine FTEs), lack of coverage/attempts to secure coverage, discrimination and pattern of organizational tolerance of discrimination/assault (recommend google search: Overlake Hospital lawsuits), overburdening of the most capable, poorly screened hires (new hires with repeated and escalating interpersonal conflicts across multiple settings, resistance to learning/training, did not have clear understanding of role they accepted), not unionized, frequent manager-initiated conversations regarding retention with minimal to no implementation of the solutions recommended, multiple EDSW abruptly and harshly disciplined after providing requested feedback to management despite performance evaluations consistently indicating they  "exceeded expectations" in all domains and having received no prior indication of complaints against them, inconsistent management response and favoritism, EDSW team moved from ED leadership to Care Management - manager is removed and unfamiliar with role and demonstrated inability and/or unwillingness to address staff concerns, manager does not consistently maintain staff confidentiality and has a history of making inappropriate comments about EDSWs to other team members creating discord and general unease and unrest.

review_title: Good coworkers, not a lot of accountability

pros: Some great people work here, patient care can be fulfilling, PTO decent, good healthcare benefits
cons: Lack of discipline and accountability for coworkers who slack off consistently, despite proof. Lack of support and communication between departmens. Understaffed. Guilt tripped my manager multiple times when needing to call out sick. Many RN’s with negative attitudes, make it hard to work with them and it is likely due to the understaffing and heavy workloads.

job_title: Patient Access Coordinator in Bellevue, WA
pros:
-They have great benefits. 
-They usually have opportunities for your own career growth.
cons:
-Compensation is one of the lowest on the Eastside/Western WA. Not competitive by any means.
-They do not give performance bonuses, they only give the market increase once a year (this isn't given to all employees - depends where you are in relation to the change in market cost of living).
-They do not compensate well for experience. Once you are locked into/accept a wage/rate, you are stuck with that for the foreseeable future.
-HR does not protect/assist their employees. They are the voice of leadership.
-There is a severe lack of leadership (especially with integrity) and they lack the CORE values of the company. They don't lead or manage the staff well and it is very unfortunate. 
-Staff is spread too thin and they don't utilize the staff they do have properly.
-The toxic nature of this company stems from the top down. There is so much potential, but they are hurting the growth by the way it's managed.
-Unfortunately, as proud as I was to start working there, I cannot recommend this organization until they fix some of these major issues.

job_title: Lactation Specialist Mothers Express Manager in Bellevue, WA
pros: Room for advancement, Team effort, State of the art
cons: Horrible traffic which makes it difficult to get to

review_title: Pay OK, still getting it together
pros: Competitive pay, good benefits, alternative schedule
cons: Management doesn’t know what to do

review_title: Great facilities, but hostile, unsupportive environment for new hires
job_title: Emergency Department Social Worker in Bellevue, WA
pros: I was hired to work in the emergency department. It is a clean, spacious, organized department with state of the art treatment rooms.
cons: Horrific working environment for new hires. I was expected to start work 2 days after receiving job offer. My entire orientation period ( to the EPIC medical charting software, to policies, workflow, facilities, everything) was one and one half days.  My particular supervisor was vindictive and unsupportive, and refused to answer questions after my "training period" was "over".  Other staff told me that it was "a harsh way to learn, but that's just how it is here. We're a tough bunch" (direct quote from nursing supervisor).  I was hired to relieve someone who had been in the position for 13 years, and this person had no idea how to get a new employee up to speed beyond threatening or criticizing the newbie.  After 5 days I was scheduled for a performance review--usually happens after six months. I worked 12 hour days for 2 more weeks. Constant criticism, with no helpful support or meaningful guidance. When the hostile environment became untenable, I finally resigned.  No amount of compensation could have made me extend for even one more day.

review_title: Great core staff, management heavy, Fiscally stretched to thin for current and future growth at workers expense
pros: Core staff and practitioners are amazing to work with especially with upper management fiscal and practice constraints. The motto is usually "do more with less." the staff provides exceptional best practice care.
cons: Constant budget cuts, usually understaffed for best patient care. Top heavy management puts constant pressure on unit managers. High daily turn over for ICU and delayed transfers to the floor. Poor nurse staffing ratios for ICU nurses with frequent telemetry assignments with little tech support.  Epic system is a lot of duplicate charting and too many pages. Lastly, poor long-term employee recognition and no formal exit process-last day I handed my badge to the security guard as I left the building.

review_title: I've had the absolute privilege to call Overlake my second home for about 14 years.
pros: As in any area of one's life, you get back what you put in, and what I see is a lot of hard work and dedication by staff and leadership alike.  Overlake leadership has always been highly supportive of staff and it's a wonderful place to work, and to receive care.  Overlake just feels like a family, and is absolutely committed to providing the highest quality, safe, and compassionate care possible.  This is evident in comments and compliments I hear on a daily basis from patients, family members, and even vendor customers.  With Mike Marsh at the helm, I see big, exciting things in Overlake's future!
cons: The changing healthcare climate is affecting everyone, and Overlake is not exempt from that.  Challenges do not cons make however, and my personal belief is that Overlake is rising to the challenge and will continue to grow and get better.  Exciting times!

pros: Overlake has a clear mission to serve the people of East King County and to improve the health of this community.  They walk their talk, they are committed to living this in the way they develop their clinics, services and daily interactions.  OMC is big enough to really make a difference and to provide excellent primary and specialty care services linked with a top community hospital.  OMC is also small enough to be nimble and responsive and to feel like a family.  I am making a difference here and love it!
cons: As a non-profit, community based and relatively smaller independent system - resources can be constrained and while nimble, there is a limit to how fast or how much change we can take on at once.  Heavy traffic in the area is a burden too, but the City of Bellevue is working on many things to help keep this area moving for future growth.

review_title: Think twice before leaving your Medical Technologist Job elsewhere
pros: Good commute, small hospital, pleasant upper management, aimed to serve a target population, apparent empathy and compassion for patients suffering.
cons: Very deceptive in regards to the nature of the jobs they post. The supervisors are micromanagers that believe that procedures have to be done in one way only and that is theirs which they learned decades and decades ago. When it comes to empowering and embracing new ideas and focusing on the employees strengths to gain cooperation they are completely clueless and fearful. The old school belt and punishment to gain control type management reigns in the lab.  This is a reflection of their lack of experience and insecurity as they have been doing the same job forever without exposure to modern management.

review_title: A small family of hard working individuals strongly dedicated to the organization
pros:
People genuinely beleive in Overlake, as a place to work, interact and make better.  It's a fast paced organization that can't behind a corporate culture or system mentality.  Everyone works very hard.  The culture is one of camaraderie and I've never felt that I couldn't call anyone directly to ask questions about problems or issues.
Financially appears very strong and the organization appears to be working towards a long range goal of remaining independent.
cons: Change is slow and cumbersome.  I view this as a positive at times because reversing bad decisions can take even longer to fix. Did I mention the work pace is fast.  :-)

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Bellevue, WA
pros: It was a great work environment and most of the staff is very friendly. I floated between many units as a PCT and most of the time was welcomed and able to get along with everyone.
cons: Slow to change on the most current best medical practice. Still using paper charting... and the doctors take the charts throughout the day shift which makes it hard for RN's and PCT's to go back and remember what to chart. Still taking temperatures in the ear... not best practice. And some of the nurses there have been there so long they are lazy and get away with it because of seniority when new nurses are running their butts off and getting hassled for little insignificant things.

review_title: A mix of few great people and a mass number of mediocre
pros: The food is one of the best at a hospital I've ever had in the Pacific Northwest.  Great location and wonderful surgeons.  For the most part very friendly staff.  They are extrenely well positioned being in Bellevue - just off I-405.
cons: Horrible benefits (especially for being a Healthcare organization), delusional leadership, poor pay and growth opportunity.  Too many office politics.  Their organizational values are not appreciated or encouraged - although they claim to do so.

review_title: I am extremely grateful and proud to have gained valuable technical skills and lasting friendships from OHMC Laboratory
pros: Great location, beautiful facility, quality driven laboratory, hopsital culture of integrity, respect and accountability, free employee parking, hard working managers and supervisors who lobby tirelessly for their employees and for patient safety
cons: Not for profit hospital that is challenged with budget constraints that affect resources and staff morale annually. Toxic employees are difficult to get rid of due to the HR policies that require extensive documentation of such behavior.

review_title: IT management is weak and Epic build was done poorly
job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Bellevue, WA
pros: Semi-modern workspace with some window view seating, because of many open positions there is a high chance you can be sent for Epic certification.  Only outsources helpdesk to India, as opposed to Franciscan/Catholic Health Systems who outsources most of IT to India.
cons: Poor IT management on many levels, poor initial Epic EMR build makes support and maintenance frustrating, management has limited technical knowledge therefore doesn't understand root cause of issues, pay is on low end - be sure to add 10 to 15% of any offers you receive from HR.  No ability to work from home or travel.

pros: Better-than-average benefits package; Free employee parking. "Amiable" employees
cons: Poor use of EMR.  Lack of collaboration between departments.  behind-the-times for use of tech.  Overlake operates as if it's in the 1950s- Physicians are Kings, all else are "support staff".  They have not figured out how to develop nursing, and do not allow for thinking outside the box.  Lack creativity in problem solving.  Rely on management and physicians to determine solutions.   No continuing education or specialty-focused education.

pros: Overlake is a growing, innovative, and caring healthcare organization with a network of clinics and a world-class, acute-care hospital in the heart of the booming Eastside. Work with leading physicians, cutting-edge technologies, and an inspiring community of professionals that will challenge you everyday to be your best.
cons: Bellevue's housing prices are very high and many employees have to commute from long distances. Traffic congestion on the Eastside is the worst that it's ever been. This could make Valley or Prov Everett more appealing for employees who live outside of the Greater Eastside.

pros:
Great hospital. They have top outcomes and patient satisfaction is high. For nursing the job is definitely better than average. My staffing ratio is great here. I work in the ED. The salary is on par for what I expect to receive in the area. This is due to the higher percentage of paying patients on the east side and the strong nursing union. 
My nurse manager is AMAZING.
cons: Currently the union is having trouble solidifying a contract with the hospital. The union is strong and the nurses expect to have a good contract moving forward.

pros: Highly invested employees who care about what they do.  Lots of educational opportunities.  Strong Mentor program.  Offer a MA Apprenticeship program for staff looking to start a career path.  Free Parking.  Lots of discounts for local things- sports, summer activities, movies etc.  Very friendly HR Staff.  Hold staff accountable to policies and really live the Organizational values.
cons: Some new hires seem to forget where they interviewed and then after hire think complaining about their commute is professional.    Wish they would start expanding clinics toward North end.  Managers seem to spend a lot of time reminding newer staff to stay professional (more than they needed to 10 years ago!)

pros: locations locations locations. It is located at the heart of Bellevue with large amount of networks and client base in the area. The hospital itself is doing very well financially.
cons: Lack of a robust EHR/EMR system that really offer the solutions that most healthcare facility depend on. The whole culture in the organization towards technology has been lacking, and the organization is paying the price of losing their competitive edge.

pros: The best thing about Overlake is the PEOPLE. They are mission driven and CARE about the patients and community they serve as well as their TEAM! The organization also cares about it's employees and we are treated well. We also have some FUN and we are appreciated....I would not have stayed for 25+ years if it was anything but a great place. Try it, you'll like it..
cons: People work so hard and I think a bit more appreciation would go a long way. Taking care of others often times comes before taking care of self. I would love to see more options for wellness, day care and other amenities.

job_title: Health Information Management Technician in Bellevue, WA
pros:
Since our CEO Mike joined, safety has been a big focus. He has a great positive attitude.

Excellent co-workers - we're a team.
cons:
Human Resources could treat employees better. I sort of feel like a criminal whenever I have to communicate with them, so I just avoid them.

Department I work in generally goes unacknowledged by the clinics we work for until something goes wrong.

pros: Working at Overlake feels like you are part of a family.  We are all here with the same mission of taking care of every patient, one patient at a time even for those us in non-patient care roles.  I have been at Overlake for 13 years and had the opportunities to work in different departments in different positions.
cons: Overlake runs very lean.  Overlake is successful financially because of this but it means a lot of hard work.

review_title: Overlake Medical Center is an Amazing Place to Work
pros: Overlake staff are supportive of one another, management seeks feedback and really listens to what their staff desire in a work place, and the benefits package, including free parking is generous and affordable. We are one of the highest paying medical centers in the region. There is a spirit of fun, creativity, flexibility, and innovation that is hard to find anywhere else.
cons: Getting to Overlake from the South end or West side can be time consuming, but Overlake provides ORCA passes to all their staff to ease their commute.

job_title: Anonymous Employee Urgent Care in Issaquah, WA
pros: Anyone looking for a career vs just a job I recommend Overlake. The organization values commitment, provides generous benefits, and is in tune with its employees. This is not a stuffy old organization, but dynamic and open to suggestions. Directors and managers makes rounds regularly asking front line staff how it is going. You know when you are delivering quality care for the community when other urgent care clinics refer you to an Overlake one. They are a cut above.
cons: I cannot thing of any downsides to working at the Overlake Clinics

pros: Eco-friendly environment with staff who are engaged in providing great care.   Location is easy to get to from major roadways and provides free parking to employees.  Work is challenging and provides opportunities to advance your skills.
cons: Commuting into the area is heavy so allow time or take public transportation to make it easier.  The work culture is going through some transitions, but the expected outcome should have positive results for staff.  Current on site construction makes it noisy and difficult to maneuver through, but it's not forever.

review_title: Fantastic hospital with top ratings in healthcare and patient experience.
pros: Excellent healthcare services with great career opportunities.  The Grade A on Leapfrog, five star rating on health grades and Gold plus elite in stroke care make us a step above all other healthcare facilities on the east side. Very proud to be apart of the progressive care team on South 4 that provides excellent patient care in a teamwork atmosphere that makes being a team member phenomenal!
cons: Traffic on 405 can be challenging, but worth the drive to be on an outstanding team with vision and proven track record.

review_title: Overlake is a great place to work!
pros: Overlake has an exceptional executive leadership and management team and with the addition of the new CEO, is sure to make great advancements in healthcare.  The shared values of ICARE are fully supported and encouraged among all staff.  Our patients receive precise, compassionate and individualized care.  Employee benefits (including tuition reimbursement) and pay are comparable to the larger organizations in the area.
cons: Unfortunately, like many healthcare positions, there are limited opportunities for career advancement.

pros: Decent benefits and free parking
cons: Behind in so many ways. Huge budget constraints. No one knows what they are doing and don't seem to care, especially leadership. Huge mistakes are done daily. I would never allow myself or a family member to be treated here. Nothing moves along at a decent pace. Communication and teamwork is non-existent, but they sure like to put on a show to make it look like it. Don't waste your time here, people stay because they can get away with very little work.

review_title: A company preparing for buy out or bankruptcy.
job_title: Clinical Informatics RN in Bellevue, WA
pros: You get a cafeteria discount and the food is good.
cons:
Hardly any direction to do your job
Very deceitful when it came to down sizing.  I was told that I was hired for 2 years.  They fired our manager then they told us that our jobs was secure and we are now permanent employees.  Then a week before they laid me off, they gave us a 3% raise.  Very deceitful. 

It appears they are cutting their bottom line to improve their profit so they can be bought out by someone with competence.

review_title: Great Place to Work, Critical Care
pros:
-Leadership team takes staff concerns to heart, I've seen many changes made in the past couple of years
-Highest pay in the area
-Free staff parking
-Approachable manager 
-Patient safety and excellent care is a priority 
-Beautiful work environment
-Excellent, trustworthy, and supportive team
cons: 405 traffic is not so good, however if working 12 hour shifts you will miss all the big traffic!

review_title: Worked for many organizations; Overlake is by far the best!
pros:
The organization takes care of their employees Benifits are above average. Paid time off is excellent. Very good onboarding.
Very good leadership at the executive level; have the organization heading in the right direction to continue growth.
Financially doing well and have remained so during challanging times.
And should probably mention the excellent location.
cons: Not a lot that Overlake is not doing right. Maybe more attention to support functions. But that is part of working at a hospital; focus is on patient care (which they do very well).

review_title: The staff and managers at Overlake are wonderful!
pros: The culture at Overlake is caring, compassionate, welcoming and warm. Overlake is very community focused and supported. Overklake is always striving for new ways to improve upon what is already the most EXCELLENT of patient care!  Overlake has great benefits and is very fair with compensation policies. Overlake is very stable and finacially sound which has been very comforting in these tough econmical times.
cons: As a not for profit, non taxed supported hospital, Overlake has to work very lean.

review_title: I came to Overlake in 2012 and have I enjoy getting up everyday and coming to work.
pros: I believe in their philosopy, their committment to all patients, the community and their values.  We are centrally located. have incredible physicians and staff who are committed to providing excellent care.
cons: I have along drive each day but find the rewards outweigh the drive.  Need more IT support.

job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Bellevue, WA
pros: Overlake has been a positive working environment for me.  The people are very caring and have been a joy to work with.  It is a company that cares about being fair and works hard to create a positive experience for there employees.
cons: It is a company that is forced to run very lean to survive in a very challenging healthcare environment.  Many of the extra perks have been cut and medical benefits have increased throughout the years.

review_title: Employee, worked in two different departments
job_title: Medical Record Technician in Seattle, WA
pros:
Overlake is a very transparent company.   There are regular meetings/information sessions from the CEO, telling us what's going on.
All of the supervisors I had the pleasure of working for were very nice and supportive!
Overlake is a very welcoming place.
cons: It seems that the supervisors have a lot on their plates.   They are very nice & can handle it, but sometimes it seems like it's a lot.

review_title: Overlake is the worst place to work for nurses in the Seattle area
pros: Free parking, nice coworkers, convenient location
cons: Terrible upper and middle management. This is the worst place in the entire Seattle area for nurses to work. They treat the doctors like gods, and their nurses, MAs, & PSRs like disposable garbage. The pay and time off is terrible. Do yourself a favor, and don’t even apply for a job here.

review_title: Great coworker relationships, overall culture and teamwork, management style/ workload is overly demanding and strict.
pros: Culture is great, company wide values are very positive. Transparent communication and creating a comfortable environment for learning are highly valued and practiced.
cons: Management style is outdated and very demanding. Often asked to complete more work than physically possible while also avoiding overtime. Reprimanded even when within the seven minute "grace" period for tardies. Meetings scheduled during lunch and/or after work.

job_title: Super Sitter Instructor in Bellevue, WA
pros: Fast paced, friendly atmosphere, co-workers worked as a team!  It was a great job and privilege to have been a part of such a fantastic team.
cons: They aren't in Texas - which is where I moved.  I would like to have seen some health benefits for part time employees, but it is not uncommon in the market place for there to be no health insurance for part timers.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Seattle, WA
pros: Really caring workers and friendly environment. The job makes you feel like a team and co workers are there to help when you need it. Team atmosphere rather than individualized.
cons: Still new to the job but so far it has been great. Only con I can think of is the disconnection with the clinical staff. Wish there was a better way of connecting the admin and clinical staff together to build relationship.

pros: Free Employee Parking, & Orca Cards
cons: Yearly Salary Raises Are Low.

job_title: Issaquah Urgent Care Team Member in Issaquah, WA
pros: The Overlake Urgent Care network is Top Notch. Care is delivery with care and concern for the patients. Teamwork is valued and staff trust one another.
cons: Overlake Issaquah and Redmond Urgent Care offer the community extended hours, weekends and holiday healthcare. This is beyond what other organizations provide. Great for the patients, can be long shifts for the staff.

review_title: They do not grow talent here well.
pros: If you're an introvert, you'll fit it. If you perform strong work, they will verbally tell you so. To the extent of feedback is average, and the departments perform above average at the frontline to middle management level. The upper management is easy to talk to.
cons:
The policies and regimented nature make the entire advancement process daunting, untangling, and passive aggressive. They have a poor HR department with terrible resources around them. They do not email you back in a professional length of time. Expect Overlake and their HR department to be snail-paced, to rarely make a presence in your department, and to limit your potential while working here. 

Coming from someone who knows many ins and outs about Overlake, I have appreciated the people there. It's the main reason why I worked there. The main system "GAP" Overlake has is its lack of progressiveness when it comes to treating their employees like most large PNW companies do-they do not scale up fast enough, they do not think inductively (forward thinking), and the are mainly deducers (reactive thinking). This has the feel of a Midwest hospital with a shiny skin. 

They are not progressive and if you're thinking this place is the next Fred Hutch or SCCA, you're in for a treat.

job_title: CRT, RRT, RPFT, NPS, M Ed in Bellevue, WA
pros: the food was good  at the cafeteria
cons: If they do not like you, Nurse make stuff up and get you out of their, !  I was Employee of the year in another Hospital I came here and within 2 weeks I was gone... Nurses made things up just to get rid of me...this is the worst hospital I had ever worked.. After this Hospital I have been employed with the placed for over 15 years without a complaint go figure? Over Lake go figure?

review_title: Company who cares for patients and tries to care for employees
job_title: Population Health Coordinator in Bellevue, WA
pros:
Supportive managers who encourage growth
Work-life balance 
Autonomy and trust in their employees to do their work
cons:
Pay is below market rate 
HR is slow 
It is a medical institution - so hierarchical and uptight atmosphere  
Little upward mobility as it seems you have to wait till someone leaves or retires to take their position

pros: All staff work and strive for the best possible care for patients and families.  Everyone wants to learn how they can do their job or make things easier for clients.
cons: Many positions do pay overtime, there is a great deal of work to get done in an unrealistic timeframe most days.

review_title: Lack structure and out of tune leadership style
pros: Small local hospital, you get to do lots of different things.
cons: Management lacks vision. They do not have proper succession planning. The decision to go to Epic was great, but the project was not managed correctly. It will be very difficult for them to survive in the current healthcare environment.

pros:
Great benefits
Free parking
Wonderful providers and other co-workers
Competitive pay scale
Mostly great patients
cons: The phone system and centralized call center needs to be improved

review_title: Beautiful hospital, lack of education in leadership, limited recognition, staff good to work with and great location.
pros: Beautiful campus. Coworkers nice to work with. Good location.
cons: Not progressive, ie., no EMR, behind the times. Need fresh leadership to improve satisfaction. Give people a reason to stay.

pros: I loved my time working at Overlake. Unfortunately, I had to quit because I was moving back home to continue my degree. However, I loved the company, the people, the vision. I loved it all!
cons: The parking is not the best unless you are a night shift employee because you have to park in a parking garage across the street

pros: Wonderful colleagues. Managers are very helpful and approachable. Give flexibility to your schedule as per individual needs. Love the work environment.
cons: Low pay rate. No growth potential within the current department. And if you want to move within organization, you have to be with the organization for an year.

pros: Great coworkers, convenient location, light workload.
cons: None of the leadership has any clue as to how to lead. The managers don’t know how to manage. There is no one steering the ship. Bullies take over. Basic employment laws are disregarded. Great employees are let go, rather than being given basic workplace accommodations. There is no foresight. No skilled leadership. Only politics and cronyism.

pros: Overlake has a culture where employees can make a difference.  Management seeks feedback and truly listens and cares about employees.  There is a sense of teamwork and community.  I stay because of the people and I am proud of where I work.
cons: The commute can be long for some.

review_title: Insists on being a standalone, result is now sinking alone
pros: Finally converted over to EPIC online patient records system
cons: Strongly political.  Leadership dislike thinking in a business mode resulting in poor discussions.  Out of touch CEO recently announced retirement after Hospital failed to make yearly financial goals.  Hospital feels adrift with no focus as replacement has yet to be identified.

pros: Open Heart experience, Free Parking, New-ish Building to work in. Awesome scrubs to wear. Health insurance is decent! Prescriptions are 10$ for 30 pills regardless.
cons: Poor management, only cares about profit. Lot's of restructuring. No team work. Lack of good managers.

pros: People is nice work with and benefits are not bad, you get free bus pass if, you use the bus 75% of the time. This job is good for Medical assistant just starting out
cons: Medical assistant are restricted when it comes to their skills and the pay is not good for medical assistant.

review_title: Not Compliant to their own policies and procedured
pros: Had wonderful coworkers and volunteer staff
cons:
No room for advancement 
No opportunity for continued educational training
Some management are incompetent and or have no expertise in their department
HR has poor representatives starting from the top down not for the benefit of the employee
upper echelon do not take accountability for the management staff and their inefficiencies
Huge problem with diversity through the hospital unless you are an environmental service worker

review_title: Overlake is a good place to work
job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Seattle, WA
pros: Good personal enviroment to work within.
cons: Promotions and Salary increases are unobtainable due to being regulated by HR and not based on performance.

pros: Intimate setting, casual and open relationship with superiors, good benefits.
cons: Some departments entirely composed of travelers or private practice— no sense of unity. Had to take breaks in the bathroom because anything and everything is reported to the charge nurse or nurse manager.

pros: High quality medical care in the hospital
cons: Very competitive atmosphere between employees.  Management didn't know what was going on beneath them.

review_title: No focus on lower level staff
pros: close to where I live
cons: Lack of focus to lower level care team member

pros: Great work, life balance.  Hard working co-workers.  Great team atmosphere.
cons: We run on the lower end of staffing levels

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Bellevue, WA
pros: great place to work at. There is always someone for you to talk to if you have issues
cons: I am sometimes left to fend for myself if there is no one to cover if someone calls out aka not enough floats

pros: Overlake has a great culture of community.  The teams really care for each other and their patients.
cons: Traffic!  But isn't that everywhere in the area?

review_title: Great place to work - makes it hard to leave...
pros: Great salary and benefits, responsible management.
cons: Because they are a private, non-profit hospital, the bottom line is very important - staffing can occasionally be 'lean' - they run a tight ship just to keep the doors open.

pros: Physicians and nurses are very professional
cons: Management top heavy company only cares about their own growth and profits.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bellevue, WA
pros: Small, community hospital and lots of longtime employees.
cons: Staffing ratios could be better. Too expensive to live anywhere near the hospital.

review_title: look out for yourself, nobody else will.
job_title: Hospitality Unit Coordinator in Bellevue, WA
pros: Good place to get experience in a hospital.
cons: If you do not muti task well.you could get lost in the shuffle.  If you are good,there should be no problems.

review_title: I love working for Overlake Hospital, the organization takes very good care of thier employees
job_title: Vice Principal of Specialty School; Behavioral Health in Bellevue, WA
pros:
Changing lives; incredible outcomes
Being part of an engaged and skilled team
Benefits
Advancement opportunities
Active and supportive Leadership
cons: No cons come to mind

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Bellevue, WA
pros: The best part of working there was I worked with alot of great people. And the benefits we're great
cons: And I never had anything but good to say about Overlake

pros: Every month, managers would get to hear from leadership about the hospital.  Great practice and makes everyone feel valued
cons: None that I can recall

pros: Great colleagues and repeated zebra diagnoses because patients are using the clinics as emergency rooms
cons: Top heavy, specialist heavy, top down command and control management

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Huntington Beach, CA
pros: Growth and terrific people to work with.
cons: Not always current with pay range compared to industry standards.

pros: A great community of people all looking to provide the best care to patients.  Team effort
cons: Slogging through the surrounding areas to get there

pros: Very smart and caring people doing their best to be a positive contribution to the community
cons: Pay is not great. But the people are terrific

pros: Employees are great - compassionate and caring.
cons:
IT is a bit outdated and old school style in processes and culture.
Pay is not great.

pros: Wonderful people, fast-paced environment, quickly learned medical terminology on the job and became comfortable with a hospital environment.
cons: Personally, nothing was too bad about working here.

job_title: Clinical Lab Assistant in Bellevue, WA
pros: My coworkers are great, they really care.
cons: As with most places, upper level management see the big picture but not the little details that really matter.

pros: nice area, clean, new buildings and equipment
cons:
lacking good benefits
$10 for employee lunches?!

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Seattle, WA
pros: Great place to work in the heart of Bellevue. Patient care is the top priority.
cons: Low pay scale compared to other employers in Seattle.

review_title: Evaluation of Overlake Hospital by an admitting staff
pros: Beautiful place to work in a good area.
cons: Same as any hospital would have.

review_title: Great organization on the Eastside of Seattle
pros: Good community outreach and support
cons: Commute, access to downtown, and currently land-locked for growth

pros: Good free food, Good community, Caring staff
cons: Volunteering staff is kind of rude

review_title: One of the best of my life!

pros: I enjoyed the family atmosphere among co workers.
cons: Co workers not excited about letting new people in the group.

pros: great leader and crew, great benefits

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bellevue, WA

pros: Cost of living adjustments every year

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bellevue, WA

pros: Both management and peer coworkers were a pleasure to work with.
cons: Traffic to get there was pretty bad, but typical of Seattle.

pros: There is a high focus on quality and patient safety.
cons: Constnatly trying to do more with little.

pros: Benefits are very good and affordable.
cons: Too much work not enough employees.

pros: experience, experience, experience, close to home
cons: hours, night shift for new hires is normal there

pros: Great for educating employees... awesome!

pros: Not much - free parking...

pros: Great coworkers and good benefits
